DOC.brief_summary: Patients frequently experience pain moderate severe gynecologic procedure . This study prospective , randomize , placebo-controlled trial aim investigate analgesic efficacy preoperative oral dexketoprofen trometamol , intravenous paracetamol , lidocaine spray , pethidine diclofenac sodium fractional curettage procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Paracetamol , Dexketoprofen Trometamol , Lidocaine Spray , Pethidine Diclofenac Sodium Application Pain Relief During Fractional Curettage
DOC.detailed_description: A total 144 mutiparous subject randomly allocate one six group . The first group ( control group ) consist 22 participant receive treatment . The second group consist 26 participant receive oral 25 mg dexketoprofen trometamol . The third group consist 23 participant receive 2 puff lidocaine spray cervical mucosa . The forth group consist 25 participant receive 100 mg pethidine . The fifth group consist 23 participant receive 1000 mg intravenous paracetamol sixth group consist 25 participant receive diclofenac sodium .
DOC.criteria: multiparous participant abnormal uterine bleeding postmenopausal bleed myoma uteri cause menometrorrhagia cervical polyp tamoxifen treatment breast cancer adnexial mass abortion pregnancy primiparity diabetes mellitus tendency bleed thrombocytopenia factor deficiency functional disorder platelet
DOC.keyword: Curettage ; analgesia ; paracetamol ; lidocaine ; Dexketoprofen trometamol ; pethidine ; diclofenac .
